intro: Codonoboea salicina, commonly known as the Salina Codonoboea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
